articles.title: AI has led to industrialisation of cybercrime, says I4C CEO
articles.summary: The advent of artificial intelligence has led to the industrialisation of cybercrime, with a lot of automated attacks being carried out by organised gangs, a top official of the Indian Cybercrime Coordination Centre said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Earnings set for strong rebound in FY27 after weak FY26, says Mahesh Nandurkar
articles.summary: Indian investors are learning the importance of diversifying beyond domestic equities. Mahesh Nandurkar of Jefferies highlights the need for global exposure. He also notes the Union Budget has become less of a market mover. Corporate earnings are expected to significantly improve next year, driven by factors like inflation and stabilizing interest rates. Nandurkar is optimistic about future market growth.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: AI threat to financial firms is about long-term valuation, not earnings yet: Citi strategist
articles.summary: Citi remains overweight emerging markets, neutral on the US, and neutral on India within emerging markets. Drew Pettit, Director - US Equity Strategy / ETF Analysis & Strategy Research at Citi noted rising global diversification, with US investors increasing allocations to international equities and diversified fixed income.

articles.title: Hungary polls: Opposition MP Peter Magyar alleges blackmail threats ahead of Partizan interview anniversary
articles.summary: Péter Magyar claims pro-government forces plan a smear campaign before the Partizán interview anniversary, linking it to Fidesz, Göd battery factory controversy, and Russian-style tactics.

articles.title: Gold, silver rise ahead of key US jobs data
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices rose as US yields fell. Indian investors moved to gold ETFs amid risks, with record AUM and steady SIPs, says Aditya Agrawal.

articles.title: US used mobile launchers for missiles at Qatar base as Iran tensions rose, satellite pictures show
articles.summary: U.S. forces in Qatar's alUdeid, the biggest U.S. base in the Middle East, put missiles into truck launchers as tensions with Iran ratcheted up since January, analysis of satellite images showed, meaning they could be moved more quickly.

articles.title: India winding down Russian oil purchases, ramping up US energy buys: USTR Greer
articles.summary: India’s move to scale back Russian oil imports is emerging as a key pillar of the evolving US-India trade relationship, with Washington linking tariff relief and deeper market access to New Delhi’s energy diversification, tariff reductions and supply-chain cooperation.

articles.title: HP India's Bhawana Agarwal on what the country needs next to unlock AI
articles.summary: AI operating closer to citizens can enable faster responses at hospitals, transport hubs and service points. Built on platforms such as Aadhaar, UPI and DigiLocker, deeper AI integration can strengthen verification, improve fraud detection and reduce delays across government programmes, writes HPE India Managing Director Bhawana Agarwal.

articles.title: India will grow the fastest among G-20 economies in FY27: Moody's

articles.title: Global uncertainty drives market volatility; India relatively stable: Emmer Capital CEO
articles.summary: Manishi Raychaudhuri, Chief Executive Officer, Emmer Capital Partners said India has remained relatively stable compared with other Asian markets. He sees opportunities in financials, materials, industrials, and selective consumer stocks, while remaining cautious on IT services due to AI disruption risks.

articles.title: Indian Railways trials stainless steel containers for salt transport, aims to boost freight efficiency
articles.summary: The pilot on the Bhimasar–Gandhidham section demonstrated that purpose-built stainless steel containers can cut corrosion-related losses, reduce cleaning and maintenance costs, and speed up cargo turnaround, reinforcing the Railways’ push to modernise bulk freight operations.

articles.summary: Supertails is betting $30 million on super-fast deliveries, expanding veterinary clinics, and using tech to offer personalised care, aiming for ₹1,000 crore revenue in coming years.

While overall profitability improved, the group health segment, dominated by public sector insurers, continues to face significant underwriting losses, with claims exceeding premiums.

articles.summary: Edelweiss Financial Services announced that The Carlyle Group will become the strategic majority investor in its housing finance subsidiary, Nido Home Finance. Carlyle-affiliated funds are committing Rs 2,100 crore, including a Rs 1,500 crore primary equity infusion, to strengthen Nido's capital and governance for affordable housing expansion.

Gandhi insists Naravane's own social media post confirms its availability, challenging Penguin's claim and suggesting a contradiction. The publisher maintains pre-orders do not constitute publication and warns of legal action against unauthorized circulation.

The move signifies a strategic step for both global players in India's growing mobility sector.
